meanings.definition: Capable of being defended or justified.
meanings.sent1: The decision was defensible based on the evidence presented.
meanings.sent2: It is important to have defensible reasons for your actions.
meanings.sent3: His explanation was so defensible that it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her argument was as solid and defensible as a fortress.
meanings.sent5: The teacher provided a defensible explanation that stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: Able to be protected from attack or criticism.
meanings.sent1: The fort was built on a defensible position overlooking the valley.
meanings.sent2: It is crucial to have a defensible plan in place during times of crisis.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a defensible spot under the bed to hide from the dog.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was a defensible shield against negative comments.
meanings.sent5: The sturdy walls of the castle provided a defensible barrier against invaders.
